body:
[`playground link with all the code`](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=9210b8a71e4eecbcdbb61716393913b9).

# Confusing message

When compiling:

```rust
use serde_json::*;
use Value as JsonValue;

fn main() {
    let text = r#"
    {
        "key": "value"
    }
    "#;

    let _formatted = from_str::<JsonValue>(text).map(to_string_pretty);
}
```

The compiler gives this error:

```txt
error[E0631]: type mismatch in function arguments
  --> src/main.rs:11:54
   |
11 |     let _formatted = from_str::<JsonValue>(text).map(to_string_pretty);
   |                                                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |                                                      |
   |                                                      expected signature of `fn(serde_json::Value) -> _`
   |                                                      found signature of `for<'r> fn(&'r _) -> _`
```

Which is confusing, specially for people who do not understand what `for<'r>` means.

# How to fix the code

This function requires `&T` but `T` was given, so the solution is adding `.as_ref()`:

```rust
// Fixed
let _formatted = from_str::<JsonValue>(text).as_ref().map(to_string_pretty);
```

# Rust can give nice message for the same error

The same code, but with a redundant closure inside of `.map()`.

```rust
// Same error, but now the compiler gives a very nice message
let _formatted = from_str::<JsonValue>(text).map(|x| to_string_pretty(x));
```

A very helpful message:

```txt
error[E0308]: mismatched types
  --> src/main.rs:11:75
   |
11 |     let _formatted = from_str::<JsonValue>(text).map(|x| to_string_pretty(x));
   |                                                  ---                      ^ expected reference, found enum `serde_json::Value`
   |                                                  |
   |                                                  help: consider using `as_ref` instead: `as_ref().map`
   |
   = note: expected reference `&_`
                   found enum `serde_json::Value`
```
